chargeHist.descr: Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (5th or 6th)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Troy L Crain #379761 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Troy L Crain #379761 is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Troy L Crain #379761 was found guilty of Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).
  • Troy L Crain #379761 was found guilty of Possession of synthetic cannabinoid - 2nd+ offense [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(em).
  • Troy L Crain #379761 was found guilty of Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Statement by Carrie Winneshiek, sister of defendant,  Court imposed in 11CF426 on CT 1 2 years IC, 2 yrs ES concurrent to each other with 452 days jail credit.  In 14CF66 court 1 2years IC, 2 years ES, Ct 2:  2 years IC, 1.5 years Extended Supervision. Counts are concurrent but consecutive to 11CF426.    Financial obligations to be converted to civil judgment.  Eligible for Substance Abuse and Challenge Program.

Ct 1, Operate MV without Owners Consent, repeater; Ct 2 Possess Synthetic Cannabinoid-2nd and subsequent, repeater; Ct 3: Obstructing, repeater.  Ct 4 Resisting an Officer, repeater. Ct 5, OAR, repeater, Ct 6: Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance in Blood 4th within 5 years.

ADA Troy Cross appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appeared in person with Atty Ryan Frank.  Restitution and jail credit to be determined at a hearing or by stipulation.  Amended Information Ct 6:  Plea to Ct 1, Ct 2 and Ct 6 of Amended Information.  Rights/elements.  No contest plea entered.  On Ct 1 and Ct 2, court withheld sentence and placed on 4 years probation consecutive to Ct 6.  Costs $268 on each count.  Ct 6:  court imposed 4 years prison-1 year initial confinement; 3 years extended supervision.  Fine/costs $1769.00.  36 month revocation/AODA/36 month interlock.  Restitution to be paid as condition of probation.  Counts 3,4,5 dismissed.  $1000 cash bond to be applied to restitution.
